articles.title: 58% of North American Wildlife Mammals May Benefit from Human Activity: Study - News18
articles.description: Scientists used data from 3,212 camera traps set across North America to track 24 mammal species across 61 camera trap projects
articles.content: A study published in Global Change Biology found that about 58% of mammals across North America may be benefitted from human activity as they were more likely to be found in areas with increasing hum… [+1990 chars]
